verses.verse: Surely<WH3426> there is a vein<WH4161> for the silver<WH3701>, and a place<WH4725> for gold<WH2091> where they fine it<WH2212>.
Iron<WH1270> is taken<WH3947> out of the earth<WH6083>, and brass<WH5154> is molten<WH6694> out of the stone<WH68>.
He sets<WH7760> an end<WH7093> to darkness<WH2822>, and searches out<WH2713> all perfection<WH8503>: the stones<WH68> of darkness<WH652>, and the shadow of death<WH6757>.
The flood<WH5158> breaks out<WH6555> from the inhabitant<WH1481>; even the waters forgotten<WH7911> of the foot<WH7272>: they are dried up<WH1809>, they are gone away<WH5128> from men<WH582>.
As for the earth<WH776>, out of it comes<WH3318> bread<WH3899>: and under it is turned up<WH2015> as it were fire<WH784>.
The stones<WH68> of it are the place<WH4725> of sapphires<WH5601>: and it has dust<WH6083> of gold<WH2091>.
There is a path<WH5410> which no bird<WH5861> knows<WH3045>, and which the vulture<WH344>'s eye<WH5869> has not seen<WH7805>:
The lion<WH7830>'s whelps<WH1121> have not trodden<WH1869> it<WH7826>, nor the fierce lion passed by it<WH5710>.
He puts forth<WH7971> his hand<WH3027> upon the rock<WH2496>; he overturns<WH2015> the mountains<WH2022> by the roots<WH8328>.
He cuts out<WH1234> rivers<WH2975> among the rocks<WH6697>; and his eye<WH5869> sees<WH7200> every precious thing<WH3366>.
He binds<WH2280> the floods<WH5104> from overflowing<WH1065>; and the thing that is hid<WH8587> brings he forth<WH3318> to light<WH216>.
But where<WH370> shall wisdom<WH2451> be found<WH4672>? and where is the place<WH4725> of understanding<WH998>?
Man<WH582> knows<WH3045> not the price<WH6187> there<WH4672>; neither is it found in the land<WH776> of the living<WH2416>.
The depth<WH8415> says<WH559>, It is not in me<WH3220>: and the sea says<WH559>, It is not with me.
It cannot be gotten<WH5414> for gold<WH5458>, neither shall silver<WH3701> be weighed<WH8254> for the price there<WH4242>.
It cannot be valued<WH5541> with the gold<WH3800> of Ophir<WH211>, with the precious<WH3368> onyx<WH7718>, or the sapphire<WH5601>.
The gold<WH2091> and the crystal<WH2137> cannot equal<WH6186> it<WH8545>: and the exchange of it shall not be for jewels<WH3627> of fine gold<WH6337>.
No mention<WH2142> shall be made of coral<WH7215>, or of pearls<WH1378>: for the price<WH4901> of wisdom<WH2451> is above rubies<WH6443>.
The topaz<WH6357> of Ethiopia<WH3568> shall not equal<WH6186> it<WH5541>, neither shall it be valued with pure<WH2889> gold<WH3800>.
From Where<WH370> then comes<WH935> wisdom<WH2451>? and where is the place<WH4725> of understanding<WH998>?
Seeing it is hid<WH5956> from the eyes<WH5869> of all living<WH2416>, and kept close<WH5641> from the birds<WH5775> of the air<WH8064>.
Destruction<WH11> and death<WH4194> say<WH559>, We have heard<WH8085> the fame<WH8088> there with our ears<WH241>.
God<WH430> understands<WH995> the way<WH1870> there<WH3045>, and he knows the place there<WH4725>.
For he looks<WH5027> to the ends<WH7098> of the earth<WH776>, and sees<WH7200> under the whole heaven<WH8064>;
To make<WH6213> the weight<WH4948> for the winds<WH7307>; and he weighs<WH8505> the waters<WH4325> by measure<WH4060>.
When he made<WH6213> a decree<WH2706> for the rain<WH4306>, and a way<WH1870> for the lightning<WH2385> of the thunder<WH6963>:
Then did he see<WH7200> it<WH5608>, and declare it<WH3559>; he prepared it<WH2713>, Yes, and searched it out.
And unto man<WH120> he said<WH559>, Behold<WH3374>, the fear of the Lord<WH136>, that is wisdom<WH2451>; and to depart<WH5493> from evil<WH7451> is understanding<WH998>.
